summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to PayPal/Venmo on September 3, 2019, demanding financial records associated with three specific email addresses. It includes a cover letter requesting non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation into alleged federal criminal violations, including sex trafficking and related offenses.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for PayPal/Venmo
events.description: The subpoena commands PayPal/Venmo to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce records, though personal appearance is waived if records are produced by this date.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena to PayPal/Venmo as part of a criminal investigation into suspected felonies.

locations: U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena targets financial records from PayPal/Venmo associated with three specific email addresses (redacted in the text) from account inception to September 2019.
The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal laws, specifically 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requested non-disclosure of the subpoena's existence to any third party to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.
The document indicates the investigation was active and ongoing as of September 2019, focusing on financial transactions linked to the specified email accounts.
